titlestmt.titleproper: Henry Troth photo prints and photographs undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Henry Troth photo prints and photographs

bioghist.p: Henry Troth was an amateur photographer from Philadelphia. Troth displayed his work along with other noted photographers including F. Holland Day, at the 1896 Washington Salon. In 1899, he, Day, Frances Benjamin Johnston, Clarence White, and Gertrude Kasebier were selected to be judges at the Second Philadelphia Photographic Salon.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of three landscape photographs by Henry Troth: Burnham Beeches, Dunes near Annisquam, Massachusetts, and Ridley Creek.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
